Articles.Content: I was test flying a rocket and I encountered another lovely bug. I separated a stage and switched to it and set the throttle to deorbit it. As soon as I reselected the orbiter the deorbiting stage suddenly flew away at very high speed. My craft was stuck in orbit. Not moving and unresponsive. Anyone care to test this?
Like it was sitting at a certain altitude, but just not moving?

> 
> Like it was sitting at a certain altitude, but just not moving?

Yeah like it was frozen in space. Also I encountered another bug in orbit around the Mun. I decoupled from a docking port and the thing I decoupled from flew off at high speed and exploded. Left my craft hanging in space and didn't render the Mun. I have never encountered this bug before.
I recall that similar sounding things happened after .23.5 came out, possibly wit the 3.75m decoupler. Might be related.

> 
> I recall that similar sounding things happened after .23.5 came out, possibly wit the 3.75m decoupler. Might be related.

Could be. I will do some tests when able.

Yes, as they both stop in space. Mine where Caused by firing a separated stage for deorbit and another by decoupling from a docking port. It didn't happen after I reloaded though.
